Saat kuliah dulu di Matematika, salah satu _software_ yang menjadi andalan saya mengarungi perkuliahan adalah [__Maple__ (Mathematical Pleasure)](https://www.maplesoft.com/). 

```{r,echo=FALSE,fig.align='center',fig.cap="Courtesy: maplesoft.com"}
knitr::include_graphics("mapple.png")
```


```{r}
rm(list=ls())

library(Ryacas)

# contoh
eq <- "x^2 + 4 + 2*x + 2*x"

# simplify
eq %>% y_fn("Simplify") %>% yac_str()

# factorisasi
eq %>% y_fn("Factor") %>% yac_str()

# finding root
eq %>% y_fn("FindRealRoots") %>% yac_str()

# bentuk ke tex
eq %>% y_fn("Factor") %>% y_fn("TeXForm") %>% yac_str()

# turunan
eq %>% y_fn("D(x)") %>% yac_str()

# integral
eq %>% y_fn("Integrate(x)") %>% yac_str() 
yac_str("Integrate(x,a,b) x^2")
yac_str("Integrate(x) x^2")


# limit
yac_str("Limit(x, 1) (x^2 - 1)/(x - 1)")

# sum
yac_str("Sum(n, 1, Infinity, (1/2)^n)")

# ODE Solve
yac_str("OdeSolve( y'' + y == 0 )")

yac_str("OldSolve(x^2+x*y==z,y)")

```


```{r}
rm(list=ls())
library(matlib)

A = matrix(c(1, 2, -1, 2), 2, 2)
b = c(2,1)
showEqn(A, b)

c( R(A), R(cbind(A,b)) )          # show ranks
all.equal( R(A), R(cbind(A,b)) )  # consistent?

plotEqn(A,b)

Solve(A, b, fractions = TRUE)

echelon(A, b, verbose=TRUE, fractions=TRUE)

# https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/matlib/vignettes/linear-equations.html
```
